com.cfcoding.log4j.appenders

Class RequestAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
      • com.cfcoding.log4j.appenders.RequestAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.log4j.Appender, org.apache.log4j.spi.OptionHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ACFRequestAppenderImpl, RailoRequestAppenderImpl

    public abstract class RequestAppender
extends org.apache.log4j.AppenderSkeleton
    The RequestAppender collects events as they are logged within the request.

    Because logging is asynchronous across multiple threads (requests), it's important that only events within a specific thread are collected. events are logged within a thread name and timestamp. That event information is compared against the thread and time reference specified in the constructor so only logs specific to the current request are collected.

    Important: As this appender is specific to a thread, the thread will eventually terminate and the appender no longer valid (unless a new thread comes along with the same name). This appender should be removed (via Category.removeAppender(org.apache.log4j.Appender) manually once the request has completed or no more logging is necessary for this appender.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestAppender

        public RequestAppender(java.lang.Thread thread,
               long time)
        Constructs a new appender specific to events logged in the thread and after the specified time
        Parameters:
        thread - thread to capture events within
        time - reference in which events this time should be consumed

      • RequestAppender

        public RequestAppender(java.lang.String threadName,
               long time)
        Constructs a new appender specific to events logged in the Thread threadName and after the specified time. This constructor traverses up the thread groups, enumerating all active threads to find a matching name. It is recommended to use the RequestAppender(java.lang.Thread, long) constructor if reference to the thread is available.
        Parameters:
        threadName - name of the thread to capture events within
        time - reference in which events this time should be consumed
